org.apache.flink.spargel.java

Class OutgoingEdge<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,EdgeValue>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.spargel.java.OutgoingEdge<VertexKey,EdgeValue>
  • Type Parameters:
    VertexKey - The type of the vertex key.
    EdgeValue - The type of the value associated with the edge. For scenarios where the edges do not hold value, this type may be arbitrary.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class OutgoingEdge<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,EdgeValue>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Edge objects represent edges between vertices. Edges are defined by their source and target vertex id. Edges may have an associated value (for example a weight or a distance), if the graph algorithm was initialized with the VertexCentricIteration.withValuedEdges(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet, VertexUpdateFunction, MessagingFunction, int) method.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • target

        public VertexKey target()
        Gets the target vertex id.
        Returns:
        The target vertex id.

      • edgeValue

        public EdgeValue edgeValue()
        Gets the value associated with the edge. The value may be null if the iteration was initialized with an edge data set without edge values. Typical examples of edge values are weights or distances of the path represented by the edge.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the edge.
